wikipedia_page.main:
Tom Johnstone (born 23 August 1995) is an England international rugby league footballer who plays as a winger for Wakefield Trinity in the Super League.
He has spent time on loan from Wakefield at Featherstone Rovers in the Championship. Johnstone was the winner of the Super League Young Player of the Year in 2016.

response: Ripley signed for Huddersfield Town in 1978 from Gainsborough Trinity by Tom Johnstone, however a few months later Johnston was sacked and replaced by Mick Buxton and only played one more game before being signed by Billy Bremner at Barnsley.
* Young player of the year: Tom Johnstone -  Wakefield Trinity Wildcats

* Oliver Holmes, Tom Johnstone, Reece Lyne, Adam Milner, Jamie Shaul, Liam Sutcliffe, Luke Thompson (all England), Lambert Belmas, Paul Marcon, and Anthony Marion (all France) made their Test debuts, while Robbie Mulhern made his debut for England having previously represented Ireland.
